message: Bob, I'm excited to offer you this product, which I believe will be a valuable asset to your company. My initial price is $900,000. I'm confident we can find a price that works for both of us.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $700,000. I believe that's a fair price considering the market value of similar products.

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, but $700,000 is simply too low.  Considering the unique value of this product, I'm willing to come down to $850,000.  This price is still fair for both of us and reflects the product's true worth.
I appreciate your flexibility, but $850,000 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer $775,000. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $775,000 still falls short of what I need to make this deal work. I'm willing to come down a little further to $825,000. This represents a significant compromise on my end, and I believe it's a fair price considering the unique value of this product.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $825,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you at $800,000, which is the price I'm willing to pay for this product. If we can't agree on this price, I'll have to consider buying from another seller.
